skill.name: debugging-strategies
skill.description: Master systematic debugging techniques, profiling tools, and root cause analysis to efficiently track down bugs across any codebase or technology stack. Use when investigating bugs, performance issues, or unexpected behavior.
skill.summary: Master systematic debugging techniques, profiling tools, and root cause analysis to efficiently trac...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is a static guidance document with examples and checklists. No executable code, data access, or exfiltration patterns are present.

content.value_statement: Bugs are hard to isolate when you lack a clear process. This skill provides structured steps, checklists, and tool guidance to reach root causes faster.
actual_capabilities: Provides a reproduction checklist and information gathering steps
Defines a hypothesis driven debugging workflow
Includes debugger and logging examples for JavaScript, Python, and Go
Explains git bisect and binary search debugging
Describes performance profiling and memory leak detection techniques
limitations: Does not run code or inspect your runtime environment
Cannot access your logs, data, or repositories directly
Cannot validate fixes without your test results
Results depend on the accuracy of your inputs

use_cases.title: Trace a production bug
use_cases.description: Use the production checklist to collect evidence and narrow a failing code path.

use_cases.title: Stabilize a flaky UI
use_cases.description: Apply intermittent bug strategies to find timing or state issues.

use_cases.title: Investigate regressions
use_cases.description: Follow profiling guidance to compare working and broken systems.

prompt_templates.title: Start a bug hunt
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a bug that happens sometimes. Create a step by step plan to reproduce and isolate it.

prompt_templates.title: Build a hypothesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Here is the error message and context. List likely causes and tests to confirm each one.

prompt_templates.title: Profile performance
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a profiling workflow for a slow API response in Node and Python.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced memory leak
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a memory leak investigation checklist with tooling suggestions for Node and Go.

output_examples.input: My tests fail only in CI. How should I debug this?
output: Reproduce with the CI environment variables and versions
Collect full logs and stack traces from the failing run
Compare dependencies and configuration with local runs
Use git bisect if a recent change is suspected
Confirm the fix with a clean CI run

best_practices: Reproduce the issue consistently before changing code
Change one variable at a time and document results
Compare working and broken environments side by side
anti_patterns: Making multiple changes without testing between them
Ignoring full error messages and stack traces
Assuming the issue is too complex without evidence

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: The guidance is platform agnostic and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: Are there limits to what it can diagnose?
faq.answer: It cannot access your runtime or data, so accuracy depends on the details you provide.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my tools?
faq.answer: Yes, apply the steps alongside your IDE, logging, and profiling tools.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it is a static guide and does not read files or environment variables.

faq.question: What if the issue is still unclear?
faq.answer: Provide logs, a minimal reproduction, and recent change details to refine hypotheses.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic debugging tips?
faq.answer: It provides a structured workflow, checklists, and concrete tool examples.
